title: am i the only one who thinks riot updating the game every 2 weeks is too frequent?
body:
at the moment I get 2 weeks of playable games, then the next month of client and in game crashes, then again, maybe if im lucky 2 weeks playable games, then again followed by a month of it being unplayable. why release a patch so often breaking the game? if the scheduled it monthly they can spent more time ironing out and introducing less bugsplats.

here i had to suffer through 30 minutes of this awful game, thanks for the teammates btw, only for

game to bug out with red scanner interaction on blue ward.

game to not recognize its crashed and my character somehow walking forward to shoot the ward and then path into lux.

after it shows the disconnect message, my character is just sitting there chillin. no running back to base, or anything. smoke break i guess.. and i get to reconnect to a lost game.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aIWpGf8ohoM

replies.body:
mate, ive played since s3. my client or connection (200/100)?? very rich,  its update to update. 

- you can clearly see the interaction between scanner, blue trinket and duskblade. which resulted in a GAME CRASH, not lag or network.
- so im standing there crashed. 
- then A FURTHER bug by disconnect state during CC causing the character to stand there and die
So it's just your client then. I didn't say it had to be your connection I said it was a possibility. It's not like anyone *has* to help you m8. Take it or leave it.

After every patch, there will be a small percentage of players who experience issues. Such is the nature of an online game catering to a staggering number of setup combinations. That does not mean those issues are not local client side, nor does it mean the common fixes won't help.

The scenario you experienced isn't exactly hard to come by, and yet there is nothing on the report a bug board or on reddit about such a bug. The most likely case then being that something somewhere isn't playing nice with your local client.

Even if it's not, instead of trying the common fixes to see if they help, you are outright refusing to based on...what exactly? What harm do those fixes do you? You appear to be treating this as if a client error is somehow a personal attack against you?

So it sounds like either your client or your connection (or both) are majorly f'ed up.

If you haven't done a clean reinstall, I would *strongly* recommend doing so with the [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends). I'd also recommend running through what steps you can in the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

If that still doesn't fix your issues submit a ticket to [Player Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and they should be able to help you further.
